body_html:
Nope. I built from source (also tried with pip [uninstalled tf, cleared cache before each install attempt] )on another machine that has Cuda 8, Cudnn 7.05. I specified the path to the cuda-8.0 (used actual [to cuda-8.0 folder] and symbolic path [to cuda folder] on separate occasions, same error) and performed TF 1.6 configuration. When I try to import tf, I got :

ImportError: libcublas.so.9.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
Failed to load the native TensorFlow runtime.

@gunan This issue is not closed.

body:
Nope. I built from **source** (also tried with **pip** [_uninstalled tf, cleared cache before each install attempt_] )on **another** machine that has **Cuda 8, Cudnn 7.05**. I specified the path to the cuda-8.0 (_used actual [to cuda-8.0 folder] and symbolic path [to cuda folder] on separate occasions, same error_) and performed TF 1.6 configuration. When I try to import tf, I got :

```
ImportError: libcublas.so.9.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
Failed to load the native TensorFlow runtime.
```

@gunan  This issue is **not closed.**
